page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: {Bonnington}farm is owned by the Brewster twins.It was left to them by their father.They started with 650 acres and gradually built it up to 1200 acres.They own 5 farms and have 9 workers and 100 in harvest time.They have 8 tractors,1 combine,3 forklifts,1 sandbuggy and 1 lorry.This machinery is worth about Â£200,000.They have the British record for wheat and the British and world record for barley yield.They get approx.4.13 tonnes per acre.They also have 1000 cattle which is a mixture of bullocks and heffers.He uses these mainly for beef.They have 3 containers about 75 feet high which he uses to keep fertilzers in.Some of his main problems are disease,the weather and rats.He also used hen droppings for fertilizer which he puts on his fields.
